TFTCG Aequitas Draft FAQ
FAQ / Keywords /

Deck

  1. What is the 'Battlefield'? [Source: Community]
    The game area in which the characters in play are placed.
  2. What is the 'Deck'? [Source: Community]
    Your battle cards are shuffled and placed face down. You draw cards from your deck. As soon as the deck runs out of cards you reshuffle the scrap and that becomes your new deck.
  3. What is a 'Battle Card'? [Source: Community]
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Battle Cards are the cards that are placed in the face-down stack. To date they will say either Action or Upgrade on them on the middle left of the deck, and they are all the same size. They all have the same grey/white/red background image.
  4. What is a 'Character Card'? [Source: Community]
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Character Cards represent particular Transformers and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card a 'mode' will be indicated.
  5. What is a 'Stratagem Card'? [Source: Community]
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Stratagem Cards represent a background theme and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card they state that they are a 'STRATAGEM'.
  6. What is the 'Scrap'? [Source: Community]
    Battle cards you have used, either by playing or flipping, are discarded at the end of your turn. The discard pile is called the scrap.
  7. What is a 'Trait'? [Source: Community]
    Traits appear on Character Cards as icons under the character names. For example, Ranged, Car, and Titan Master.
